verses.verse: Go to <WG33> now <WG3568>, ye rich men <WG4145>, weep <WG2799> and howl <WG3649> for <WG1909> your <WG5216> miseries <WG5004> that shall come upon <WG1904> you.
Your <WG5216> riches <WG4149> are corrupted <WG4595>, and <WG2532> your <WG5216> garments <WG2440> are <WG1096> motheaten <WG4598>.

Your <WG5216> gold <WG5557> and <WG2532> silver <WG696> is cankered <WG2728>; and <WG2532> the rust <WG2447> of them <WG846> shall be <WG2071> a witness <WG3142> against <WG1519> you <WG5213>, and <WG2532> shall eat <WG5315> your <WG5216> flesh <WG4561> as it were <WG5613> fire <WG4442>. Ye have heaped treasure together <WG2343> for <WG1722> the last <WG2078> days <WG2250>.

Behold <WG2400>, the hire <WG3408> of the labourers <WG2040> who <WG3588> have reaped down <WG270> your <WG5216> fields <WG5561>, which <WG3588> is of <WG575> you <WG5216> kept back by fraud <WG650>, crieth <WG2896>: and <WG2532> the cries <WG995> of them which have reaped <WG2325> are entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the ears <WG3775> of the Lord <WG2962> of sabaoth <WG4519>.

Ye have lived in pleasure <WG5171> on <WG1909> the earth <WG1093>, and <WG2532> been wanton <WG4684>; ye have nourished <WG5142> your <WG5216> hearts <WG2588>, as <WG5613> in <WG1722> a day <WG2250> of slaughter <WG4967>.
Ye have condemned <WG2613> and killed <WG5407> the just <WG1342>; and he doth <WG498> not <WG3756> resist <WG498> you <WG5213>.

Be patient <WG3114> therefore <WG3767>, brethren <WG80>, unto <WG2193> the coming <WG3952> of the Lord <WG2962>. Behold <WG2400>, the husbandman <WG1092> waiteth <WG1551> for the precious <WG5093> fruit <WG2590> of the earth <WG1093>, and hath long patience <WG3114> for <WG1909> it <WG846>, until <WG2193> <WG302> he receive <WG2983> the early <WG4406> and <WG2532> latter <WG3797> rain <WG5205>.
Be <WG3114> ye <WG5210> also <WG2532> patient <WG3114>; stablish <WG4741> your <WG5216> hearts <WG2588>: for <WG3754> the coming <WG3952> of the Lord <WG2962> draweth nigh <WG1448>.

Grudge <WG4727> not <WG3361> one against another <WG2596> <WG240>, brethren <WG80>, lest <WG3363> ye be condemned <WG2632>: behold <WG2400>, the judge <WG2923> standeth <WG2476> before <WG4253> the door <WG2374>.

Take <WG2983>, my <WG3450> brethren <WG80>, the prophets <WG4396>, who <WG3739> have spoken <WG2980> in the name <WG3686> of the Lord <WG2962>, for an example <WG5262> of suffering affliction <WG2552>, and <WG2532> of patience <WG3115>.

Behold <WG2400>, we count them happy <WG3106> which endure <WG5278>. Ye have heard <WG191> of the patience <WG5281> of Job <WG2492>, and <WG2532> have seen <WG1492> the end <WG5056> of the Lord <WG2962>; that <WG3754> the Lord <WG2962> is <WG2076> very pitiful <WG4184>, and <WG2532> of tender mercy <WG3629>.

But <WG1161> above <WG4253> all things <WG3956>, my <WG3450> brethren <WG80>, swear <WG3660> not <WG3361>, neither <WG3383> by heaven <WG3772>, neither <WG3383> by the earth <WG1093>, neither <WG3383> by any <WG5100> other <WG243> oath <WG3727>: but <WG1161> let <WG2277> your <WG5216> yea <WG3483> be <WG2277> yea <WG3483>; and <WG2532> your nay <WG3756>, nay <WG3756>; lest <WG3363> ye fall <WG4098> into <WG1519> condemnation <WG5272>.
Is <WG2553> any <WG5100> among <WG1722> you <WG5213> afflicted <WG2553>? let him pray <WG4336>. Is <WG2114> any <WG5100> merry <WG2114>? let him sing psalms <WG5567>.

Is <WG770> any <WG5100> sick <WG770> among <WG1722> you <WG5213>? let him call <WG4341> for the elders <WG4245> of the church <WG1577>; and <WG2532> let them pray <WG4336> over <WG1909> him <WG846>, anointing <WG218> him <WG846> with oil <WG1637> in <WG1722> the name <WG3686> of the Lord <WG2962>:

And <WG2532> the prayer <WG2171> of faith <WG4102> shall save <WG4982> the sick <WG2577>, and <WG2532> the Lord <WG2962> shall raise <WG1453> him <WG846> up <WG1453>; and if <WG2579> he have <WG5600> committed <WG4160> sins <WG266>, they shall be forgiven <WG863> him <WG846>.

Confess <WG1843> your faults <WG3900> one to another <WG240>, and <WG2532> pray <WG2172> one <WG240> for <WG5228> another <WG240>, that <WG3704> ye may be healed <WG2390>. The effectual fervent <WG1754> prayer <WG1162> of a righteous man <WG1342> availeth <WG2480> much <WG4183>.

Elias <WG2243> was <WG2258> a man <WG444> subject to like passions as <WG3663> we are <WG2254>, and <WG2532> he prayed <WG4336> earnestly <WG4335> that it might <WG1026> not <WG3361> rain <WG1026>: and <WG2532> it rained <WG1026> not <WG3756> on <WG1909> the earth <WG1093> by the space of three <WG5140> years <WG1763> and <WG2532> six <WG1803> months <WG3376>.
And <WG2532> he prayed <WG4336> again <WG3825>, and <WG2532> the heaven <WG3772> gave <WG1325> rain <WG5205>, and <WG2532> the earth <WG1093> brought forth <WG985> her <WG846> fruit <WG2590>.
Brethren <WG80>, if <WG1437> any <WG5100> of <WG1722> you <WG5213> do err <WG4105> from <WG575> the truth <WG225>, and <WG2532> one <WG5100> convert <WG1994> him <WG846>;

Let <WG1097> him <WG846> know <WG1097>, that <WG3754> he which converteth <WG1994> the sinner <WG268> from <WG1537> the error <WG4106> of his <WG846> way <WG3598> shall save <WG4982> a soul <WG5590> from <WG1537> death <WG2288>, and <WG2532> shall hide <WG2572> a multitude <WG4128> of sins <WG266>.
